text: Easy Pineapple Fudge Grease a 10-inch pan with oil or butter. Set aside. Pour milk, butter, and sugar into a medium-sized pot. Turn the pot on medium and heat slowly until it just starts to boil. Add the crushed pineapple and stir until the fudge is smooth. Make sure that there are no large pineapple lumps. Pour the lemon juice in and let the fudge boil for two minutes. Pour the fudge into the greased pan and place the pan into the fridge. Let the fudge chill for five hours or until firm. Cut into squares and enjoy! Dairy-Free Pineapple Fudge Grease a 9x5 pan with dairy-free margarine or oil. Set aside. Combine sugar, corn syrup, pineapple, and butter in a medium-sized pot. Turn your stove to a medium setting. Bring the fudge to a boil. Stir until the fudge has no lumps. Once the fudge is smooth, bring the fudge down to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract. Check to see if the fudge has the right consistency. It should be thick and smooth. Pour into greased pan and place the pan in the fridge. Let the fudge cool for 2-3 hours or until firm. Cut into squares and place on a plate or platter to enjoy. Store in an airtight container. Creamy Pineapple Fudge Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Set aside. Pour sugar, milk, pineapple, and butter in a large pot and set your stove on high heat. Stir until smooth. Remove from stove and add marshmallows, nuts, and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Check to make sure that the fudge consistency is smooth. Pour the fudge into the pan. Place in a fridge and let the fudge chill for 3 hours or until firm. Cut into squares and place on a plate or platter. Store in an airtight container. Enjoy!
